reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really loved this hotel.We both enjoyed the glorious grounds and walks.The hotel is really lovely and welcoming,and the food was very more-ish.We are looking forward to another relaxing visit,and maybe another round of golf.
reviews.title: We will return

reviews.text: We had our wedding in the Ballymascanlon in July and had a wonderful time. The staff were really helpful and the attention to detail was wonderful. Everything ran smoothly both in the preparation and during the day.
reviews.title: Wedding in the Ballymac, fantastic time!

reviews.text: All the guests were complimentary of the staff, the food and the accommodation.
reviews.title: A stunning hotel, perfect for our wedding

reviews.text: We will certainly be back again and would highly recommend the Ballymac if you are considering it for you wedding!
reviews.title: Wedding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got married in the Ballymac a few weeks ago & the hotel & staff could not have been better. From the first time we met with Mr. Quinn and his staff, they couldn't have been more professional & helpful to us. The hotel itself is a perfect blend of old & new architecture and the grounds were we had our photos were amazing. The food was brilliant all the way through the day. Our guests were delighted. Many thanks to the Ballymac for making our day what it was. I would recommend without reservation. 10/10
reviews.title: What a wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were here once before and really loved it. We still think it is beautiful. The room was spacious and bright and beautifully decorated. The bathroom was huge. We had a meal in the restaurant and we thought it was exceptional. We both had soup for starter followed by a sirloin steak. The soup was delicious. The steak was incredible. We both went for well done. it was cooked beautifully with loads of flavour. The peppercorn sauce was very tasty. The side veg and potato were outstanding too, especially the stuffed mushrooms. I had a chocolate fudge cake for dessert and it was lovely too. The waitress was very friendly and efficient. The breakfast service is also first rate. I had a beautiful full Irish breakfast. Overall we are highly impressed and will be back again soon !
reviews.title: Best steak I ever tasted

reviews.text: We held our annual conference in the Ballymascanlon House Hotel last week for the second year in a row. I have to commend the staff on their attention to detail and the level of service we recieved on the day and in the run up to the day. The staff are all so helpful and friendly and nothing is too much trouble. The feedback from our delegrates about the hotel was top marks. We look forward to working with the hotel in the future. I highly recommend the hotel for any event or conference.
reviews.title: Customer Conference

reviews.text: We stayed overnight on the 22nd October 2011 with family & a few good friends for a get together. My husband & I stayed in the older part, more traditional rooms, it was great, really lovely decor, large room, everything we needed & a lovely big bathroom. Also bed was large & very comfortable. First hotel I have stayed in for a long time where the room temperature was exact, not sure how they do it but it was exactly right.
reviews.title: This Hotel Has It All & Then More. Highly Recommended.

reviews.text: We had a most memorable meal, not one complaint from 21 diner. Plenty of compliments for the food, the room, the staff, service etc The staff on the evening were second to none, as were the managment from the first day I called in to enquire about holding a dinner for my family. Dining room was booked out that night, no problem we were told, we ended up with our guests in the Residents Lounge for the evening, our own private dining room, brilliant. What can I say, everyone just loved it, it was so much more cosy & personal & great for the 2 children we had in the family. So lovely to be able to sit around and chat after our meal without having to change rooms. Our party broke up about 1.30am & then some of the guests went to the lounge where there was still a bit of craic going on.
reviews.title: A Perfect Day!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast next day was lovely, hot, great variety, very busy though staff seemed to just take this in their stride. Next stop was the Leisure area, pool, sauna, steam room, cold plunge tub, outdoor hot tub, jacuzzi, smaller pool area for children, fantastic, really really excellent area enjoyed by all the family. It was very clean with very helpful staff.
reviews.title: Fantastic Romantic Get Away

reviews.text: Stayed for one night, great location, huge room, lovely garden. Very classy fornitures and all the staff very professional, helpful and friendly. Just the breakfast was little poor, good quality but not so various. The Hotel is in the countryside a l ittle bit isolated so you defenitly need a car. Would definately recommend this lovely hotel and I would like to go again!
reviews.title: stunning!

reviews.text: Three day family break - absolutely no complaints - great leisure centre - great food - most welcoming staff. Wedding parties in a separate location - do not overwhelm rest of Hotel. To be highly recommended for all types of guests. We had three kids under 10 and no problems at all. Great value break. If only all Irish Hotels could be like this !!
reviews.title: Excellent - sets the standard for Irish family Hotels.

reviews.text: We got married here on 11th March, we had such a wonderful day & weekend in this hotel. We would like to thank manager Chris Brayden & all the staff for all their help prior to the wedding & on the day.
reviews.title: The Best Wedding Venue in Louth

reviews.text: The standard of food, accommodation & service is outstanding, we were overwhelmed & could not have asked for any more!!
reviews.title: Just the best day!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many Thanks
reviews.title: Absolutely Top Class, friendly and professional Hotel Staff and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night whilst touring the country. The location is ideal for exploring the Cooley Peninsula. The hotel is set within its own golf course and the grounds are peaceful and beautifully kept. Very little remains of the original country house with most of the hotel being relatively new. The newer public rooms are comfortable but fairly bland. Our ground floor bedroom was large and comfortable but had one major drawback. It was very warm (no air conditioning) but the only ventilation was via a sliding door to the patio, which we had to keep closed for security reasons. All of the staff that we met were very friendly and welcoming. Dinner was very good with excellent ingredients and well presented. Breakfast was somewhat limited in terms of the cold buffet items but the cooked meals were of a good standard. We did not use any of the leisure facilities or play golf. Overall, we were very happy with our stay and would use the hotel again.
reviews.title: Comfortable and well equipped hotel in glorious grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Less than a mile off the M1 Dublin Rd yet this hotel has its own spacious grounds and gardens which are a delight. We were four couples and the men enjoyed a round of golf on the18 hole course while us ladies ate a delicious lunch in the bar terrace- you can eat inside or out depending on the weather. It is so secluded and beautifully kept with large planters of geraniums. The original mansion house has retained all of its charm and the newly built rooms, leisure centre and function room do not detract from this- leisure centre is fabulous. We stayed half board and were treated to a 3 course dinner of the highest quality. The staff are friendly, polite, pleasant and efficiI do not usually bother to review a hotel but found everything about this stay to be perfect and think the hotel deserves to be highly recommended. They just seem to have got everything spot-on without being pretentious. I
reviews.title: Top class hotel

reviews.text: What a beautifully bright, fresh hotel with glorious grounds, mixing old with modern. Spent one and a half days there at a wedding and thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. The service was exceptional, the rooms were utterly fantastic, bright and fresh and spacious. It all had such a lovely relaxed feel to it, even at such a huge wedding. We all were able relax in the patio area the following morning (and afternoon) soaking up the sun and having drinks and I wished we had booked in for another night. I shall return, hopefully in the near future. 160.00 Euro per night but one of the few places where I can say it was worth it.
reviews.title: Wish I was still there, can't wait to get back!

reviews.text: We stayed here at the end of July for a family birthday celebration. It is a beautiful location. The rooms are spaceous and very comfortable. The staff are really friendly and helpful and as I have stayed a no of times before they always remember me and welcome me back and nothing is too much trouble. There is a great choice of food and the quality is second to none. They give very good size portions. There is a golf course and swimming pool and really I think nobody could go wrong staying here. I hope to continue to visit for many years to come.
reviews.title: We hope to continue staying here for many years to come

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stunning view from the room, excellent meal, the hotel and grounds are a treasure - asked for a room well away from the wedding party and this was provided without a problem. Great location to explore cooley peninsula, ravensdale, carlingford and the rest.
reviews.title: Always a joy
